Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CEJ818
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Ibrahim Pasha. Location excellent for the historic sites. Very quiet location - just the call to prayer every so often from the Blue Mosque. Beautifully furnished and stunning views from small rooftop terrace. Airport transfer worked well, even given last minute change of flight. Restaurant recommendations were also excellent. Would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Mighty”
Reviews.Author: KMarieR
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful trip to Turkey. Four of us spent five nights at the Ibrahim Pasha Hotel and it couldn't have been a better experience. The standard rooms are small, no two ways about it. But they're affordable and very well appointed--flat screen TV, wall mounted stereo/iPod docking system, rain forest shower, top grade linens. You really have everything you need, and if you want to stretch your legs, you can head up to the rooftop terrace (with a bar and an amazing view) or down to the first floor with its cozy library and cheery lobby fireplace. The staff went above and beyond, offering suggestions for everything from restaurants to boating trips on the Bosphorus, and helping out in little ways like calling cabs, offering tea (or more potent beverages!) or replenishing wood for the fire. You can't beat the location--it's within a couple of minutes of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, the Islamic Art Museum, Topkapi and the Grand Bazaar, and there are perhaps two dozen restaurants within a five block radius. This is a wonderful place. It offers free breakfast too!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, fantastic staff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Jess_Bcn_Blfst
Reviews.Content: I would struggle to find a bad word to say about this boutique hotel. The location cannot be beaten for anyone wanting to stay in Sultanahmet, it being within a stone's throw of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the like, as well as being very near the tram. The staff could not have been more helpful, friendly and accommodating. Their knowledge of the city is superb (as is their English)and they gave excellent recommendations for food, cruises and the like. The views from the roof-top terrace have to be seen to be believed, just AMAZING. The breakfast spread also deserves a special mention, an array of the most wonderful, locally-produced food. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone, the rooms may be a little small but they are beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. A fantastic place and one I hope to return to very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel near everything!”
Reviews.Author: Honestanddirect
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a lovely trip to Istanbul with our two kids (ages 3 and 6 months). I think we were the only travellers with kids, but Ibrahim Pasha was the perfect place to stay - right near all the main sites in Sultanahmet and just a short walk to lots of good restaurants. Room 205 (overlooking street at front of hotel) was lovely - set up with a cot and with the sofa made up into a bed for our 3 year old. There is a teeny elevator - but enough to bring the stroller up and down. We had a view of the beautiful Blue Mosque from the room - and with the iPod dock, and kids movies on hand, even staying-in was pleasant and comfortable. All the guys at the desk and at breakfast were helpful and friendly - and great with the kids. I would say my only criticisms are: -Breakfast - the freshly squeezed OJ at 5TL is DIVINE and a delight - but though lots of dried fruits/ yoghurt/ bread is available at breakfast, it just didn't seem enough/ appetising. -There was a young woman at the desk when we checked out after 5 days (on 09/04/12) and it's a small thing, but after a wonderful break, she really left a bad taste in my mouth. She was rude and unfriendly and neither thanked us for payment nor our stay, nor did she bid us goodbye as we left. She was also quite rude to one of the other workers in our presence. It's a shame we had to deal with her as everyone else was lovely. Just to note - there are outlets in the room which accept a variety of plugs and there is also a mini-fridge. No kettle and no iron - but sending out laundry was fast and affordable. Living room area also very nice to hang out in and there is a laptop on hand if you need to use it. Free wifi in the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: weekend_for_two
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a boutique hotel a stone's throw from all of Sultanahmet's sights but aren't willing to compromise on quality, this is the place. My wife and I first came here on our first trip to Istanbul - we wanted to be within easy walking distance from the classic sights and sites, partcularly near the Blue Mosque, but hadn't really anticipated just how close we'd be. Rooms aren't massive but are a decent size, individually decorated and matching the ambience of confident, professional quality but with a laid-back air. Arriving at night-time via their uber-efficient airport pick-up, the (fluent English) staff settled us in and recommend we whisk straight up to the hotel roof terrace: what a view of the Blue Mosque and the Golden Horn! Truly amazing. Moving over the river to Taksim/Pera is easy - we used the tram stop by the cisterns (which alongside the Archeological Museum is an essential place to visit after the massive big two) and found the immediate area safe and easy to get around. The immediate area isn't as brilliantly easy for prams and older/less mobile visitors, but the hotel is fully accessible via ramps and a small lift. The hotel also has a cool seating/chilling area downstairs with a great diverse library, plus (free) internet access open for guests downstairs. Breakfast! An amazing array of buffet and made-to-order local goods, just thinking about makes me want to go back... no restaurant but the staff were clued-up and recommended brilliant locally-run places both nearby and over the other European side. We've been back once already - it's hard to imagine this could be bettered for the money and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Our home next to Istanbul's highlights”
Reviews.Author: Stranger101
Reviews.Content: Almost too good to be true. A small, cosy, clean, and above all, authentic hotel just literally around the corner of the Hippodrome, home to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. We stayed here for two nights in February. And how wonderful were the fire places in Ibrahim Pasha reception and library on those crisp but clear days and nights... We very much liked our cosy decorated room and clean bathroom. The whole atmosphere of the hotel made us forget about the rather hard beds... :-) Staff is great. Very friendly and helpful with practical advice on how to go round in the city. Breakfast is simple but good enough for a good start of the day, except for the coffee. Nothing unusual, but if your taste buds are into espresso and the likes, go for a cup of tea and hit the nearby Starbucks later on. We will definitely return to this little gem with the next opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie927
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 5 nights in room 406. The location of this hotel is steps from the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque, next door to the wonderful Islamic Arts Museum. The hotel itself is charming - two small lobby seating areas, each with fireplace, a large guest table and a laptop for guest use is adjacent to one. The breakfast was a large spread of breads, yogurt with many toppings, hard boiled egg, fresh veg, fruit, and olives, along with an array of cheeses. There were also a couple of cereal choices. Our room, 406, was a "deluxe" room, and we found it to be a nice size. The beds are quite low to the ground, and also very firm, but I think this suits most backs - it did mine! The bathroom was well-appointed, with a blow-dryer and large tub with a lovely rain shower head. There is a mildew issue around the bath, as the exhaust fan is located at the other end of a long narrow room. The fan was quite loud, and we appreciated this as it could provide white noise if left on. The noise from the school next door was definitely loud - I suppose happy schoolchildren at 7:15 a.m. would be a bother if you wanted to sleep in...perhaps the other side of the building is quieter. This room was on the top floor, and because it was snowy the terrace upstairs was not in use. On one occasion we quite clearly heard people above us, and I wonder how quiet this room would be at other times of the year. The layout of the room itself provided a small sitting nook with a loveseat and chair, adjacent to the tiny balcony, which overlooks the Bosphorous. A nice flat screen tv swivels so that it can be watched from the seating area or from the bed. There is a large closet - this was one of my favorite parts of the room! There was space for two large suitcases to remain open, plenty of shelves and hanging space as well as coat hooks on the wall. The safe was large enough to hold our laptop, ipad and SLR camera with a long lens on it. There was a small fridge set up as a mini-bar, with complimentary water each day, as well as beer, soda and chocolate for purchase. There was door space there where we stored our extra water bottles. Other thoughtful touches included two pairs of disposable slippers, wine glasses and corkscrew. The staff at the hotel were all really helpful and nice. Everyone spoke excellent English, and they provide very useful maps and information - even slips with directions back to the hotel in Turkish in case you need a taxi when you are out. The hotel had been recommended to us by a Turkish colleague, and the recommendation was spot-on. We will definitely stay here again when we are next in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “TURKISH DELIGHT”
Reviews.Author: BEORMUND
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel for a long weekend break in Istanbul. A really warming welcome in an otherwise chilly city. Staff very friendly and welcoming and two log fires going all day in the reception and lounge areas keep this charming boutique hotel very cosy. Situated in the heart of the Sultanahmet district, just 50 metres from the Hippodrome and Blue mosque. No need for alarm clock as the call for early morning prayers starts at 6am. Delicious breakfast, and tea and coffee available all day to refresh you on your return from a hard day's sightseeing. Roof terrace an absolute joy to sit out on, weel wrapped up in the sunshine. All in all a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “a great weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: bailey_nick
Reviews.Content: we chose this hotel on the strength of all of the positive reviews on TA and they were all spot on. the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and it is located in a great location, just 5 minutes walk from all of the major sights. the room (106, deluxe) was very comfortable and the furnishings were great;great bed, fantastic shower, loads of space. the lobby area has two lovely log fires which gives the whole hotel a wonderful smell. breakfasts were tasty and generous. we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to be in Istanbul in winter”
Reviews.Author: Tasotel A
Reviews.Content: Perfect service... Warm and cosy fireplaces and books everywhere... Very comfortable and elegant rooms (especially the large ones)...Terrace with a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque (make sure you have drink there, even when it is cold out, it is worth it!)

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly, extraordinary view over the Blue Mosque from terrace”
Reviews.Author: olivetreetravel
Reviews.Content: Istambul was under the snow after many years, the weather was extremely cold and my wish was to get at Hotel seeing and getting warm in the intimacy of the fireplace in the library, reading their interesting books about art, architecture, photography, etc. At the top terrace I could enjoy the excellents and magical views over the ancient and monumental Mosque Agia Sophia. Was magical ! A good breakfast, completed with a natural orange juice, and also expresso. The staff is helpful and comunicative. The location is perfect, I could make many walks around Sultanamet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Hic_sunt_leones_83
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a perfect location with very tasteful decor. Hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Deluxe room was nicely decorated with very comfortable bed (really enjoyed the cinnamon soap in the bathroom). Breakfast is good quality with fresh local produce. Only downside: outside noise (call to pray coming from the blue mosque at 5 am is rather charming - however the screams and yelps from the nearby school later on in the morning are not much fun).

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well-positioned”
Reviews.Author: gtho82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this cozy boutique hotel. Common areas had comfy seating and fireplaces, although we didn't use them too often. The highlight for us was the terrace, with an absolutely fantastic view of the Blue Mosque (you can also get a partial view of the Hagia Sofia). Our first room (the standard room) was really way too small (although it was nicely updated, with comfy bed, modern bathroom fixtures etc). So we ended up upgrading to a larger room, and were very happy we did. The staff and service were really great. The front desk was very helpful in acquainting us with the neighborhood and addressing any concerns. It was especially nice to order tea up on the terrace. Breakfast was nothing special- some breads, cheeses, etc. I would recommend asking for the freshly squeezed orange juice (although they charge an extra 5 Lira, its worth it- its a very large glass). The location is just a few steps from the Blue Mosque, and within easy walking distance to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi, and other sites in Sultanahmet. This was ideal for us, since we wanted to see all those sites but were limited in time. Note that the Sultanahmet area is not a "happening" area (it's quiet at night, although not in a creepy/shady way). If you are looking for more nightlife, Taksim might be a better option. We went to Taksim on two nights. It's very easy to get there via public transport (the tram and metro/funicular), but you might have to take a cab home since the subway closes around 12:30am.

Reviews.Title: “Ibrahim Pasha”
Reviews.Author: mswvtbeirut
Reviews.Content: We have traveled to Istanbul twice in the past two years, both times staying at the Ibrahim Pasha. While there are many positives about this hotel, the top two are its location, and the staff. The hotel is literally steps away from the Hippodrome. The staff is incredibly helpful. They go out of their way to make your stay pleasant. We also enjoyed the plentiful breakfast, the free wifi, drinks by the fire in the lounge in the afternoons, the rain showers and the ipod dock in the room. While the place is a bit pricey, but given the cost of other places in Istanbul the Ibrahim Pasha is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Tastefully decorated.”
Reviews.Author: pleroma
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here at Christmas 2011. Overall assessment is that Ibrahim Pasha Hotel is good: we had a positive experience. The super-wide-angle images of the rooms on the website lie, as they do on every hotel website, so the deluxe room is in fact more cramped that one is led to think. However, the room was warm, as it needed to be: the weather was vile - cold, windy and wet. In the room was a wall mounted docking station for iPod or iPhone which also had FM radio and CD player. Some good Istanbul photobooks and some ethnic Turkish music CDs. A big plus: Jordi Savall's famous 'Istanbul' music CD. Ara GÃ¼ler's 'Istanbul' photo book. The hotel is tastefully and pleasantly decorated. A good supply of books in the library. A couple of roaring log fires on the ground floor. Complimentary tea and coffee served to guests at all times. A laptop computer available for guest use in the library area. WiFi throughout the hotel but speed was slow and could not download video or send Facebook messages well, I found. There was only one fail: the room safe would not lock. The staff attempted to fix it but failed. After further prompting it was fixed a couple of days into the stay. An inconvenience but only a minor one. Recommend Balik Sabahattin fish restaurant a 10 minute walk away. Excellent mezzes. So good we dined there twice. Close to very efficient, reliable and frequent tram - which crosses Galata Bridge to downtown area - stops nearby to the hotel making most things in the city within easy reach without having to resort to taxis and face traffic jams. Just a few yards up the street is a convenience store. The owner will make toasted cheese sandwiches. He sells beer, cigarettes, fresh squeezed orange juice, fruits, biscuits, nuts, crisps, bottled water, etc. I would not be unhappy to revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location but over priced”
Reviews.Author: nottyandnice
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 2 nights in balcony room 106 and 1 night in twin room 103. Balcony room was nice with big jacuzzi tub and all amenities, but twin room was a disaster. Tiny and dirty and mouldy bathroom and over priced for the room. Staff was super helpful friendly and knowledgeable. Went out of their way to answer all queries and help as much as possible. great intro to istanbul with maps and all....Breakfast was more than adequate for this boutique style hotel although would ahve preferred some warm options as it was very cold and rainy then.. But free tea and coffee all day was a great bonus and well appreciated. even on their terrace which was beautiful for teh Blue mosque and Aya Sofia

Reviews.Title: “hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: enidan81
Reviews.Content: The interior design of this boutique hotel was very tastefully done, mixing modern conveniences (such as a study with laptop/printing facilities with wi-fi that's free throughout the hotel) with more traditional decoration. However, the main selling points of this place are the following: 1. Location. It is right behind the Museum of Islamic Art (the former palace of Ibrahim Pasha) and is probably little over 100m to the Blue Mosque, which means that everything within Sultanahmet is within walking distance. The bazaars are only around 20 minutes away and the nearest tram stop is about 10 minutes away. The hotel has a rooftop terrace with a wonderful view of the Blue Mosque. You can sit and gaze at it in awe as you sip the free tea/coffee that is available 24/7. 2. Very attentive staff. You are given a welcome drink and a detailed map of the main districts of Istanbul. We found staff to be very approachable, and we were served an excellent breakfast each morning. We also found the little things to be very helpful e.g. an umbrella when needed and the ability to buy tram tokens from the main desk. Guests get a 10% discount when paying by cash.

Reviews.Title: “Really close to all the sights”
Reviews.Author: CroydonBoy
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, really helpful staff. On top of Blue mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. Great for sightseeing in Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “The very best location for your Istanbul trip”
Reviews.Author: Gordon F
Reviews.Content: Very frendly with loads of helpful advice,good breakfast, free tea 24/7, good wifi, It is a perfect location for sightseeing, everthing in walking distance. Room 105 is the best in the house, others were small. I will go back there next time I need to buy a watch in the bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: SpaGreece
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the mix of traditional and modern and the excellent service at this unique boutique hotel. The location is excellent - only a few steps from the Hippodrome, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Every time we sat at the main fireplace we couldn't get ourselves up! Staff was very helpful. Complimentary coffee, tea and Turkish Delights in lobby and in guest rooms. Free wi-fi, great breakfast, beautiful central stairwell and decor is awesome if you're looking for something different than your average hotel. The rooftop lounge offers breathtaking views of the city, Blue Mosque and sea.

Reviews.Title: “Really well-run mini-hotel”
Reviews.Author: kabalatchi
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly, effective, service. Minute single room, but functional and pleasant-looking. Great roof terrace with incredible view. Fast wifi included in room price. Nearby parking.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed emotions on service and room size”
Reviews.Author: Mark_Daemen
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor feedback and positive words in the by us very trusted Rough Guides. We stayed for 4 nights/3 days. I will start with everything we really appreciated and deserves a 'excellent'. The map they provide is really helpfull. Good description of neighbourhoods, walks to do... We trusted on the 2 day trips (that you can also find on the website) and weren't dissapointed. On the second day we changed the Galata Tower for a walk downhill through Cihangir, Cukurcuma to Tophane, which shows the upcoming neighbourhoods of Istanbul. We followed their restaurant suggestion Balikci Sabahattin and loved it. Simple food, good wine and less rushed through the meal then in other restaurants. We loved breakfast in the hotel and certainly the fresh orange juice which is freshly made as you are waiting for it. As we arrived back rather late each afternoon we didn't really got to appreciate the roof-terrace but the times we just stayed up for a couple of minutes were great. The ultimate plus is the location on 100 meter of the Blue Mosque in a clean and quite location. So why rate 'Average'? The room we had on the third floor was really small. We always do appreciate if we can put our clothes in a closet when staying for more than one day. This is impossible as there is no closet, just because there is no room for it (there is a rack with space for two suitecases). The morning after the first night we asked if it was possible to have an upgrade as their own site was showing availability. The person at the desk was clearly not amused. After a while she gave us the key of the available superior room and said that we could check it out, without any further detail. We saw that the room (on the back) was bigger with more windows and with a couch (no chance of a real closet neither), so said ok to it. What a mistake. What she did not tell us was that the room was adjacent the neighboring schoolyard with even the steps of the school next to the room. So wake up call very early. The morning after we re-complained and happily could return to our prior room. What a relieve. From then on we slept well. Good to know is that prayer in the Blue Mosque is around 5u30 at night but that it's only put through the megaphones for a couple of minutes. We got used to it, but if your a light sleeper... In the evening after changing again we found a bottle of wine in our room and in the end got some compensation so for us this dealt with the problem. Perhaps it was down to just a bad day of the person at the desk as she also was very blunt to someone at breakfast asking for the weather. The response was, I don't know for today but yesterday it was rainy and 12 degrees. Yes it rained for let's say 20 minutes and it was somewhat cooler than the days before, but these directions made the person doubt his clothing which was more than ok for the day ahead. Luckily there was another guest to set the perspective straight. I would recommend the hotel if you get a good deal and are sure about the room surface and position (front). If you never had a hammam experience I recommend Cakaloglu Hammam with the full treatment (with soap massage) for 60 euro. It lasts for just about an hour but I came out reborn.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in the City Centre”
Reviews.Author: sarall
Reviews.Content: A beautifully decorated, comfortable, quiet boutique hotel within 1mins from the Blue Mosque and 5 mins from Hagia Sophia Museum. Lovely rooms cleverly utilising space. The decor is very stylish , mixing contempory with graceful chic. If I am to be critical ,it needs maintaining to keep the style sharp.Staff very helpful and friendly. Rates good for its situation. A stunning rooftop terrace affording views of the Blue Mosque. Breakfast perfect, ask for the orange juice(â‚¬5 extra) huge glass and very fresh.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: I chose this boutique hotel from the website photos and all the positive reviews. I was not disappointed. It is a block away from the Blue Mosque. It is a four minute walk to the tram or the Grand Bazaar. It couldn't be more conventiently located to everything. The staff was exceptionally hospitable. Breakfast was great. Internet was easily available in the comfortable first floor living room filled with excellent coffee table type books about Istanbul. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. Well, I don't think you're going to miss the call to prayer anywhere in town, but we enjoyed that experience along with all the others in Turkey. I guess the most striking thing to me was how nice and friendly everyone was in Istanbul. That was not just a facade to court tourists, they were really genuine. I often saw the locals helping each other just out of a kind heart. I always felt safe walking around. People seem busy with their daily activities. There were lots of cats around town. One had taken up residence outside a hotel where the doorman had placed his sweater for a bed, next to a dish of milk. One cool morning, I noticed that the doorman had partly covered the curled up cat to keep him warm. Little, caring things like that typify what nice people they are.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in fab location”
Reviews.Author: Pinklady61
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 4 nights in this lovely hotel. The trip started with them sending us a taxi to meet us at the airport. The room was lovely with a marble wet room and fresh fruit. A little dark for my taste but very Turkish, although modern. The hotel staff were charming and could not do enough to help us. They had their own map with important places marked out and a review of some recommended restaurants, all of which were excellent. The attention to detail was great, sending us out with their own umberellas, beautiful books near a log fire place and an amazing view from the top terrace over the Blue Mosque. A great place for an evening drink after a hard days sightseeing! It is very well located with only a 5 min walk to the Blue Mosque, 10 to Hagia Sophia and Topcapi and Grand Bazaar. Would highly recommend this hotel for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, and so friendly.”
Reviews.Author: choosycatEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem - situated just off the Hippodrome and within easy walking distance of the main attractions of this amazing city. The staff are welcoming and friendly, and nothing is too much trouble . Tea and coffee are served whenever required and free of charge. Breakfast spans four hours and is very good. We had booked a standard room which was quite small but perfectly adequate. We had a room overlooking the front of the hotel and my only criticism would be the nosie of the gate opposite which when opened was disturbing. So if booking again, I would recommend asking for a room at the rear. Other than that, I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wish we had known about the beds!”
Reviews.Author: rosalindAymestrey
Reviews.Content: a charming hotel and Ali the receptionist couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.However this hotel is not for people of a certain age! we booked a delux room with a balcony and were dissapointed that the balcony looked on to a brick wall. We were on the first floor and just below was where the staff sat when they wern't busy; they smoked nonstop so we couldn't have the balcony door open and there were no windows! However the main problem was the beds which were virtually on the floor. I have had two hip replacements and found it very difficult getting out of the bed and had to do so on all fours! we asked to move rooms but were told that they were all like that. They very kindly did not charge us for the three other nights that we were due to stay and so we moved to another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in great location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nkamerer
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. I researched hotels a lot and glad we chose this one. The Blue Mosque and all of the top sights are within 5 minutes walking distance. It is decorated very tastefully and makes you feel like you are in a nice Turkish home. The breakfast is so good and the staff is really friendly and helpful. The guys at the front desk were great and so was the guy who served us wine on the roof on the night we arrived - very hospitable. The view from the roof is breathtaking. Great rooftop to have breakfast or sunset drink. They have created a guide which they give you when you check in - this is so helpful - I did not even need a guidebook. We took one of the recommendations on restaurants and it was spot on. I will be recommending this hotel to friends and family who visit Turkey. Lovely. The only reason I am not rating it a 5 is because the bathrooms are a bit small, but I have heard they are larger in some of the other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and amentities”
Reviews.Author: charley2xx
Reviews.Content: My husband and i had a wonerful honeymoon at the Hotel Ibrahim Pasha. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly, the breakfast was delicious and the view from the roof terrace was breath-taking! Best bit was the location - 3 minutes from the Blue Mosque and other local attractions of Sultanamet. We have two sets of friends who will be visitng Istanbul in the next few months and i am very happy indeed to recommend that they stay with at the Hotel Ibrahim Pasha. We had an enjoyable and hassle free stay - it was the perfect honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, but no attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: sim k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. Arrived really late, so were relieved to find that our room was a cute deluxe double with a balcony. But as my husband showered, it emerged that the drain was blocked---with matted hair of previous guests (presumably) that the night guy was reluctant to remove, so my husband had to do it. Then we discovered a half finished, rather sorry looking bottle of moisturiser wedged between the wash basin and the wall---another unpleasant discovery. And as if that wasn't enough, the tap fell off! Ofcourse we put it back on without complaint as we decided we couldnt really be surprised any more and we were too tired to shift room and all that. The good thing was that the staff were very helpful dispensing with touristy advise...their restaurant recommendations were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel with best location”
Reviews.Author: mauricenaef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibrahim Pasha for two nights in Aug '11 and must say the Service we received was just outstanding. A special mention has ti go to GÃ¶ckhan from the reception! Seldom I have seen such devoted and warm service! The terrace had a lovely view and the whole hotel has a stylish interior. The rooms are rather small as quoted in previous reviews (we had a standard room) but its fine for a couple! Breakfast is rather minimal but all in all the quality and freshness was fine. There are no blankets just to mention, but otherwise I will definetly recomend this Hotel and revisit by chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walking. I'm glad we picked it.”
Reviews.Author: wdpmd
Reviews.Content: Incredibly friendly, helpful staff. Reasonable breakfast included. Located in the old part of town close to the water. Very close to the blue mosque and not far from Topkapi, Agha Sofia. Grand bazaar is easy walk. Several great restaurants within 10 minute walk. Don't miss Khorasani. Nice roof-top bar with good views of the blue mosque and of the Bosphorus/Sea of Marmara. Rooms were smallish but fine. Very modern bathrooms. Some of us heard the 5AM call to prayer. It didn't detract any from my sleep and I enjoyed hearing it. Others were oblivious to it. Hotel can arrange airline transfers for a very nominal cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wished we'd found it earlier!”
Reviews.Author: Antipodeankiwi
Reviews.Content: We had two stays in Sultanahmet, Istanbul and wished we'd booked this quiet, stylish hotel for our first and longer stay. All staff members could not have been more helpful or more friendly. Every request was met with professionalism and the advice and directions given was perfect. Our street-side room was air conditioned, quiet and spacious and had a large bathroom and an open luggage/wardrobe area. Our only criticism was that the shower needed some bleach on the floor tiles in a couple of places. There's free wifi access and a laptop downstairs for guests to use. Breakfast is excellent and there's a roof terrace that offers wonderful views out over Istanbul. We wouldn't go anywhere else if we were staying in Sultanahmet in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel - best location”
Reviews.Author: farbster
Reviews.Content: Best location in Istanbul. Walk to many of the sites like Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia etc. Our room for 3 nights (best one they had) was same price as one night of Four Seasons in the same neighborhood. The workers were extremely nice and helpful. Free breakfast included breads, hard boiled egg, cereal, coffee, tea, yogurt etc. Free wi-fi was very nice. Only negative was that the bed was very low to the ground and the mattress was super-hard. Not sure if that is a Turkish thing and it didn't bother me. I would absolutely recommend this and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel that feels like Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: polomarco23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I prefer staying in hotels that have character, but also have all the modern amenities of western hotels. Cleanliness, decor and service are also very important. We found all these qualities in the Ibrahim Pasha Hotel. It is also centrally located and just steps to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia and tram stop. The staff are all very friendly and knowledgable and take the time to provide recommendations on restaurants, sites, carpet stores, etc. Our deluxe room was a decent size by European (not American) standards. It was tastefully decorated and the bathroom had all the modern fixtures to make this a boutique hotel. The breakfast was wonderful and fresh and included all the standard Turkish fare. One of the highlights of the hotel is the rooftop terrace bar. Ending our day with a glass of wine at sunset while looking at the Blue Mosque is one of the moments that made our Istanbul visit so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: pra51
Reviews.Content: Great location in a quiet side street with no through traffic, but within 10 minutes walk of all the major sights of Sultanahmet. Staff are friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and spacious. Good buffet breakfast spread with lots of Turkish specialities.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Istanbuljoy
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay for 2 weeks & my good initial impression did not wane at all over that time! Great location. Clean & tidy...I love the smell of whatever they wash the linen in. Well stocked & managed breakfast bar. Very helpful & pleasant staff on the front desk & the woman who runs the rooftop bar is terrific. The bonus is the lounge with oodles of gorgeous books. Could have done with another week to flick through those! Happy to recommend it to anyone heading to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: Maysze
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within five minutes walk from the blue mosque and the hagya Sophia as well as the sultan Ahmet tram station . Everything a first time visitor to Istanbul might need and want to see is within easy reach. The only downside is that one can hear everything from the adjacent toilet in the rooms 05 and 06 on all floors as the bathrooms appear to share a thin common wall. A little uncomfortable if your travel companions are in the next door room! Would suggest the 06 rooms which have a balcony . These are the deluxe rooms but the regular rooms look quite good too. Staff at front desk and dining room provide excellent service and are helpful even late at night

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janeandallen
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, right in the centre of the tourist sights. 50m from the Hippodrome and 100m from the Blue Mosque. 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar. Quiet backstreet location. We had a standard room, which was small, but fine for a few days on a city break. For 40 Euros they arranged for a car to meet us at Ataturk Airport and charged it too the room. Modern western standards throughout. Everything was very clean and the air conditioning worked fine. Hotel staff very friendly and obliging, with excellent English. Good orientation talk with free hotel detailed map of the city on arrival. Plus there were more detailed handout maps of the Grand Bazaar and timetables for the Bosphorus Cruises. They even had tram tokens to sell. The nearest tram stop was 7-8 minutes away. Excellent buffet breakfast; bread, simit (local bagel), lots of fruit (fresh and dried), yoghurt, cheeses, cereals and great coffee, all included in the price. OJ was extra. The view from the rooftop terrace was stunning, especially after dark - the Blues Mosque etc, plus there is a bar up there. Lift to 5th floor and walk up a spiral staircase. Great laying in bead listening to the call to prayer. Very good library in the lobby - lots of English and foreign language books on Istanbul and Turkey, plus very comfortable leather sofas. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME, one of the nicest hotels we've stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: gilesh71
Reviews.Content: Just great. Great, simple, comfortable (deluxe) room. Lovely breakfast. Great position. Fantastic terrace for drinks with a great view. Staff went out of their way to help you & were quick to make recommendations. The hotel has a really really great feel. Full of character. We could only get 2 nights out of our 4 in Istanbul. For the other 2 we "treated ourselves" to the SAS Radisson Blu on the Bosporus in Ortekoy. The Radisson was so disappointing after the Hotel Ibrahim Pasha.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: martijntheunissen
Reviews.Content: I went last summer to istandbul and had a great holiday . i stayed at the pasha hotel wich is a good hotel, , rooms are good, airco and the beds were good. but especially the location of the hotel is the reason i went there, right in the middle of sultanahmet (tourist part of istanbul) here are al the sigtseeings!! the hospitality was even better,

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here - It will ruin the experience of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Live2TravelNow
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the hotel...The hotel staff is very friendly. However, the bed is awful. Felt like sleeping on the floor. The shower and sink were filthy with mildew. Absolutely no privacy with the bathroom next door - can hear everything, which is disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, friendly staff, fabulous location and great views”
Reviews.Author: mimi_nyc25
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter weekend and loved it. The staff were nothing but helpful and friendly - booking restaurants, taxis, giving advice on where to go/eat/etc. Loved our little room on the top floor. Was worried that the room would be tiny, after reading some reviews but the room was lovely and just big enough for two of us. The room was right by the stairs to the lovely terrace, with amazing views of the Blue Mosque, but not in the least bit noisy. Delicious breakfast was a great start to the day and if we hadn't been busy eating our way around Istanbul we would no doubt have spent more time by the lovely open fire place with a book and glass of tea. Loved the central location too - so handy for everything in Sultanahmet. Would most definitely go back - in fact we want to go back very soon to explore more of the city.

Reviews.Title: “An original, handcrafted gem”
Reviews.Author: paul_stothard
Reviews.Content: We only stayed a single night, which was not enough to enjoy fully the wonderful location. The hotel was found to be comfortable and charming, and it is clear that it has been lovingly furnished and maintained - and the house has enough features to be interesting in itself (see the real fireplace in the entrance lobby, the library and the amazing roof terrace) . The staff were extremely helpful throughout, including in telling us where to go and what to see in an extremely short stay. We enjoyed the breakfast very much. Homemade breads and jams and fresh juices were just what we wanted after a day of travel. Having read the other reviews, I agree that the room was small (although tasteful). We had two small children and I suppose that the room would have become oppressive if we'd had a longer stay. But what can they do? Smash apart a historic building in the most ancient part of one of the world's most historic cities? It is what it is, and they've done the best with the canvas that they have been given. If travellors want something grander, I would suggest a chain hotel closer to the airport. This place is more about unique character, warmth and location (which couldn't possibly have been any better).

Reviews.Title: “Glorious and Rafe Fiennes for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sosheflows
Reviews.Content: It's as good as the reviews suggest. Yes the rooms are small but they have everything you need and are offset by nice lounges with open fires, libraries of books, complimentary beverages and turkish delight! The service was excellent, it's about 20 yds from the blue mosque, the breakfast buffet is great - including sharing pastries with Rafe Fiennes and Tom Hollander, wireless everywhere. Istanbul was chilly 2nd week in April so the log fires were a boon and we did manage to get onto the roof terrace once. I'd definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the friendliest small hotel set in the historical part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NB123456
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 night stay at this boutique hotel in Istanbul. The staff were wonderful - warm and welcoming. We ate at both restaurants recommended by them - excellent. Tea and freshly made cake every afternoon by the fire - a well earned treat after walking all day around the magical city of Istanbul. This is a hotel I would recommend and would definitely return to. Winter or summer go upstairs and look at the magical view from the roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: henridavies
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel. It is in the heart of the historic district of Istanbul directly behind the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Art on a quiet street. All the major historic sites are no more than 10- 15 min walk away. The eclectic stylish interior and wood fire burning in the entrance hall add to the charm and fantastic service. The staff were all eager to help and suggest restaurants and places to visit that were off the tourist track but were authentically Turkish. We had a wonderful 5 day visit to Istanbul because of this.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis”
Reviews.Author: aliesha19
Reviews.Content: After staying in many cheaper hotels all over Europe it was such a wonderful relife to walk into this warm and very inviting hotel. We arrived on a cold spring night and were welcomed with a warm traditional drink and an open fire place. The staff were extremly helpful and our delux room was perfect, we epecially loved the heated floor and extra large shower. The downstairs area has two open fire places and big leather couches were you can un-wind and sip on a complimentry hot drink which you can also have delivered to your room at any time. The hotel provides free wi-fi and use of the hotel laptop as well as bottled water and fresh fruit. Overall- a great hotel to escape the hussel and bustle of busy Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: dfb_13
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the ibrahim pasha hotel, Staff was wonderful and very welcoming, they had a room ready for me to put my things in and offered me breakfast at 10am while my room was being readied as check in was until 1pm. I work in the travel industry and this rarely happens where a room is waiting for you before the check in time and I never expected it nor did I ask in advance. I loved the hotel, i was on my own for one night, i have been to istanbul many times an have stayed in the large grand hotels of istanbul and to be honest I preferred this one for friendliness, atmosphere and location.Rooms are not huge an I had a larger room. Larger room had a closet to put your luggage in. I just booked my next stay at this hotel for the 10th of march.For ist timers to istanbul this hotel is in the ideal location, major attractions are a 2 to 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I lived here.”
Reviews.Author: MWagnerSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: This small hotel exudes charm - it has been immaculately and lovingly designed. It blends exotic and rustic Turkish elements with modern design. The rooms are a little on the small side, but if you can swing it, go for a deluxe room; you'll get a fab little sitting area. The lobby sitting areas are cozy and inviting, and the breakfasts (which are included) are delicious. And it is located right near all of the sites you're in Istanbul to see; it is steps away from the Hippodrome, and right across the park from the Blue Mosque. The street it's on is very quiet, so there is little road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel with antastic staff who anticipate your every need.”
Reviews.Author: teregramLondon
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 stayed here for 5 nights. It was a pleasure from start to finish.The hotel has a warm and welcoming, yet with a laid back and hip atmosphere.There are open fires in the foyer and the reception staff have extensive knowledge of the city and excellent English.Nothing is too much trouble for them. The bedrooms are small but super clean with decent mattresses, new pillows and thick crisp cotton sheets. Fruit is supplied daily in the room and fresh tea and coffee is made on demand.The breakfast is AWESOME. I ate my body weight in yoghurt and the local breads. The attention to detail does not go unnoticed for example there are umbrellas in the foyer and they sell tokens for the metro.The location is great and quiet but think about some ear plugs as the morning call to prayer from the nearby mosque may be enough to wake you at 545 am!

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel In the Center of it all”
Reviews.Author: SagHarborAlice
Reviews.Content: A friend who was in Istanbul on business recommended the Ibrahim Pasha Hotel. I stayed almost 2 weeks and stayed in two other hotels as well during my 3 week visit to Turkey It is a great little hotel..clean & friendly..not fancy yet an excellent value. There are some sound issues - the sounds in the hotel carry - yet it never was a problem after about 8PM. and not in the mornings. There is a computer for guest use on the main level. The hotel is located very near the Islamic Arts Museum, the Blue Mosque, and the Hagia Sophia Mosque. Beware of the overcharging cabbies in this tourist area...the hotel staff were helpful with this issue. I came to look at Turkish textiles and I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fantastic location but what a disappointing room....”
Reviews.Author: Francis12345
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for the past few months. We visited Ibrahim Pasha for 4 nights back in October. It's tough to criticise this gorgeous little hotel, so full of character, charm and fabulous staff. However, I did feel it was important to make a point about the room size. We are not hotel snobs and do not have a problem at all with a snug space. However, I feel this hotel is at risk of losing it's edge by charging an extremely inflated price for a room that is so cramped that you cannot turn round in the shower nor comfortably walk down each side of the bed. We paid 175 euro per night which was top whack given the season. But just felt that no amount of charm could account for this price given the teeny tiny size. It really took the shine off an otherwise lovely experience. We would still highly recommend Ibrahim Pasha to all who travel to Istanbul, but would not recommend you book a standard room unless you get a good deal....and do not suffer from claustrophobia!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - relaxing and thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TimLondon65
Reviews.Content: Took my other half away for her birthday - long weekend and our first visit to Istanbul. The hotel had been recommended to us by a friend, and we weren't disappointed; incredibly welcoming, friendly and helpful staff, great location just off the Hippodrome, comfortable room on the 4th floor, good breakfasts and lovely log fires to welcome us back after a days sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “thouroughly wonderful hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: lls0
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is exceedingly helpful and very gracious at every turn. THe hotel rooms and public spaces are both stylish and charming in equal measure. The location is terrific. We had a thouroughly wonderful first visit to this fun and exciting city in large measure because we stayed here. We recommend this place the Ibrahim Pasha most highly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel; Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: amwinj
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Ibrahim Pasha hotel twice now. It is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location - just off the Hippodrome - for exploring Sultanahmet on foot (and now that the tram service extends into Galata, it's easy to go further afield, too). The rooms are modern, clean and comfortable; the staff are extremely friendly and helpful; and the breakfasts delicious! We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in this fascinating city. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Laidback luxury and excellent service in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Tsucag
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ibrahim Pasha in December 2010 for a five night break. We had very good communication from the hotel in advance of our trip, and this set the tone when we arrived. We were greeted with a glass of sherbert and useful advice about the city. We knew from earlier reviews that the rooms were on the small side but opted for the standard size anyway, and this proved to be absolutely fine for our purposes. The view out on to the street and the large windows gave a sense of light and space and the call to prayer drifting in reminded us of our location in the heart of the old city despite the modern amenities. The bathroom was small, but had a fantastic shower. The hotel has an excellent location, close to the tramline (really efficient and easy to use) and near the main historic sites such as the Basilica Cistern, Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The hotel reccommend restaurants nearby and will make bookings and call taxis for you, although we preferred to choose for ourselves. The restaurants nearby are very geared to the tourist trade and we found a bit of wandering in other neighbourhoods was beneficial. The breakfast is excellent, although the same every day there is plenty of choice. The only thing I would add is that they do charge for orange juice... a little picky of me, but I think this should be included. Everything we asked of the staff was done quickly and with kind words. The staff are generally young-ish and laid back and give a sense that they belong or live in the hotel and aren't just there for their shift. This makes for a really nice atmosphere. We spent a few early evenings before dinner sitting in front of the fire in the lobby with a book and a glass of wine, chatting with fellow guests and staff and playing with the lolloping labrador Godot. It felt really lovely 'coming home' to the hotel if we'd had a long day of walking, getting lost in the Bazaar or hopping between bars and restaurants in Beyoglu. We would definitely reccommend the Ibrahim Pasha to friends, in fact we already have.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, tiny shower, hard bed. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: MikB024
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed in Istanbul (which we loved) at Ibrahim Pasha having read the good reviews. We were there for six nights. Positives: o Excellent location near the Blue Mosque at the heart of Sultanamet o Friendly and helpful staff who are full of good advice o Attractive lobby area with laptop o Great terrace with lovely view Negatives (and remember this was a larger deluxe room): o Small room with poor layout o Tiny bathroom with the smallest shower I have ever seen o Hard bed (and I mean hard) o Boring repetitive breakfast I think we can guess we were not over impressed. Our hearts sank everytime we returned to the room after a days sightseeing. Perhaps we got a bad room. So would we return. No.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place to come back to every night”
Reviews.Author: MITOMAD
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 6 night stay at the Ibrahim Pasha. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice and friendly. Breakfast was really good and overall the hotel was really nice, decorated with great taste. The fireplaces gave a wonderful welcome back every night with their particular warmth and smell. The location is excellent too. Our room was very comfortable, but a bit small. It is a place we would definitely go back to and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: yvoryan
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I recently stayed at the Ibrahim Pasha for four nights. As other reviewers have said, service beforehand was great - it was very straightforward ordering a car to collect us from the airport - and everything from checking in to checking out was more than easy. We booked deluxe suites, which were all lovely - comfortable and contemporary - with views of the Bosphorous. The rooftop terrace also had glorious views of the Bosphorous and the Blue Mosque. The main attraction of the Ibrahim Pasha was the service, which managed to be easygoing and completely professional at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: bbwilletslp
Reviews.Content: perfect location, charming--all amenities---lovely breakfast--intimate atmosphere---Clean, comfortable, modern and well located small hotel but their greatest asset is their friendly, accommodating staff. Their knowledge and recommendations were right on making our stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, modern hotel, convenient for main sights”
Reviews.Author: Coddfish
Reviews.Content: We received a friendly welcome to the hotel, complete with a local map and advice on walks, sights, restaurants. Our room was large with a sofa and chair. The beds are very low and quite hard. Excellent shower / wet room. Free wifi. The roof terrace is small but commands a fantastic view of the blue mosque, and they do a beat gin and tonic. The Turkish breakfast was simple but fresh. The hotel does not do dinner but they recommend several restaurants with a 10 minute walk. We tried several and all were good if a little expensive. The location is convenient but the immediate streets are not especially great. There seemed to be a nicer area just south of the blue mosque, but I doubt its hotels were better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but can't help feeling it's too pricey for what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Londoner_from_IS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, helpful staff, lovely little touches (maps, recommendations, etc) but I come away feeling that it's too expensive for what you get. I understand that it's an old converted building but for 175/Euros a night, I expect more than a bed . Rooms are teeny tiny - there's barely enough space to be upright. In the bathroom the showers are smaller than a phone booth and more space is need for toiletries. However, the beds are very comfortable with down pillows although I find the lack of a top sheet annoying. Wifi is advertised but it's only available on the ground floor - not throughout the hotel. Also, there is a computer available but it seemed to be occupied a number of times by a friend of the staff or a staff member. Minor quibbles for some but for me more space is needed to justify the price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hospitality”
Reviews.Author: aziobro
Reviews.Content: Although the double rooms were miniscule, this botique hotel is a gem. Every staff member was completely dedicated to amazing hospitality. The rooftop bar with a stunning view of the Blue Mosque is such a treat and the Turkish breakfast was the best we experienced in out travels.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant little hotel with great service.”
Reviews.Author: HKO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Location is good, room is tastefully decorated, rooftop deck is superb, and service is awesome. We arrived at 9:30 from our overseas flight and they were able to check us in right away, and let us have breakfast, which was a nice gesture. Hotel's restaurant recommendations were uniformly superb. Only (minor) downsides: room was smallish, even though we upgraded to a deluxe room, bathroom was very smallish, mattress was a bit on the firm side. overall, would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, very efficient, very helpful, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Bill_and_Sue
Reviews.Content: We got 'stuck' at the Ibrahim Pasha during the volcanic ash problem. Six nights extended to eleven. We couldn't have been more lucky. The staf were unfailingly helpful and sympathetic. The loan of a wi-fi laptop made a "crisis" really quite tolerable. Our room (a 'superior' room) was lovely. A good size with a view of the blue mosque and a really good shower. Room was impeccably clean and cleaned daily. Breakfast was very good and bar service in the evening was charming. The location was an easy walk to the main tourist sites and the tram did the rest. No need for taxis at all and the trams were fun, frequent and cheap. Yes we would stay there again - and yes we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: viehly
Reviews.Content: Six of us stayed at this hotel and it was a perfect place for us. It was close to all the sights, their rooftop bar was wonderful, and the folks at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful, accommodating and friendly. The breakfast was great, free internet access, they will help you with whatever you need. I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. Thanks to all at Ibrahim Pasha!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, cozy hotel with courteous and efficient servce”
Reviews.Author: ontheroad241
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed a week at Ibrahim Pasha Hotel, just as Ramadan was beginning. The staff were unfailingly well-informed and efficient. The rooms were comfortable with good air-conditioning, for those of us from parts of the world unaccustomed to taking the heat without it. Also, the gourmet breakfasts were just a treat - a great way to start a busy day of site seeing in Turkey. And the roof top terrace had a fabulously view of the Blue Mosque, with drinks service and comfortable seating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Perfect hospitality”
Reviews.Author: TeresaFWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: The heart of this hotel is its gracious hospitality and eagerness to please guests. From arranging transportation to and from the hotel, to arranging for a certified tour guide, to greeting guests with fresh fruit in your room upon arrival, the hotel staff made me feel well-pampered. The breakfast is a feast for the eyes as well as the stomach. This is a true hidden gem in the old part of the city within a block or two of the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, Topkati Palace, and the Museum of Islamic Arts. Although the standard rooms are small, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: JIS_2
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights in mid-July, Ibrahim Pasha was a great find (through reviews on this site and Google search). I generally prefer boutique hotels and this one ticked all the boxes in terms of location, value for money, service, etc ... the roof top terrace is special with a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque and across the the Bosphorus. Ozgur was efficient in responding to e-mails and very helfpul, always a good sign, the service and staff were no different. The guests were cosmopolitan and on the same wave length, as in friendly without being obtrusive. The key attractions of Sultanahmet and trendy restaurants, shops, etc are close by but you are not situated in a busy street which is a plus. The only suggestions I have are to have soap dishes in the bathrooms and an extra wastebin in the room (unless ours were nicked) which is really a compliment as there really was nothing else I would change.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say enough about this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: archdude
Reviews.Content: Privately owned and operated, this hotel is in the heart of the historic district where you can walk to all the major sites. Located on the Hippordrome right next to the Turkish Islamic Arts Museum and across from the Blue Mosque, the call to prayer can be heard while enjoying a drink on the rooftop bar. It's fabulous. They provide electricity converters, hair dryers, water and fresh fruit, and the breakfast each morning is outstanding. A short walk to the Turskish bath house, the staff is so friendly and helpful they will assist you in everything from dinner reservations to purchasing a rug. I am in the hotel business myself and quite picky. I cannot reccommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Artllan
Reviews.Content: Our room was not large but this was more than compensated for by the location, the quality and style of the furnishings, the view from the roof top terrace, the excellent breakfast and the friendliness and helpfulness of all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant and charming hotel in a superb position”
Reviews.Author: morwenna55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May and the whole experience came well up to expectations. The room was quiet, stylish and comfortable and we were lucky enough to have a bay window overlooking the Blue Mosque. The generous buffet breakfast set us up for the day and the roof-top terrace was a great place to chill out after a hard day's sightseeing. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful. We thought the overall quality of accommodation and service was excellent and the only very minor criticism we have is the eye-watering bar prices - they really should display a price list so you can decide how much you're prepared to spend on a beer!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well situated.”
Reviews.Author: AZBecky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming and well situated in the Sultanhamet area of Istanbul. It is within walking distance of the tram and all the major sights. It's roof top bar overlooks the Blue Mosque and is a very pleasant way to relax prior to going out for dinner in the evening. Their restaurant recommendations were excellent as well. The staff were very pleasant, and helped us to easily facilitate to an upgraded room which we needed because of our multiple suitcases. The breakfast food was fresh and appetizing. They have a laptop computer available for guests' use. I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is also popular with Europeans, so book early.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SpotAthens
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us - and I'd recommended to all my friends. It's perfectly located, the rooms are beautifully furnished and the staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. Breakfast was lovely and the view from the terrace is fabulous. It's a little more expensive than some of the hotels, but it was worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “a real find - sophisticated and friendly”
Reviews.Author: meersman
Reviews.Content: This was a brilliant place to stay right in the heart of Sultanahmet. It's beautifully postioned and wonderfully restored. Very tasteful. But what really makes it extra special is the friendliness of the staff. They are proficient in English which makes everything very easy it must be said. Nothing was too much trouble. I had to be up at 5am one day and they still made me coffee! Oh yes, and free wireless in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and charming”
Reviews.Author: Cestrian56
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to find a hotel in Istanbul which has genuine charm based on its attractive blend of old and new unlike many of the new hotels in Istanbul striving to be 'authentic Ottoman' but resembling more like Disneyland buildings. The best feature of the hotel are its staff who are all extremely helpful and knowledgeable. The location is perfect for visiting the main tourist sites whilst not being part of the large swathe of new hotels south of the Blue Mosque. It is also a very quiet (apart form the wailing from the mosque) and the rooftop terrace provides a superb view across the bay and also the Blue Mosque and a place to chill out when you need to escape the teeming street life of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DRHamilton53
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit for five days and returned to Ibrahim Pasha at the end of our trip to Turkey. A beautiful boutique hotel with a great atmosphere in an ideal location. The breakfast staff were fabulous and we left feeling like old friends. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Package in Centre of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: psandps
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days staying in room 305: a good size, very comfortable with its own balcony with limited views of Blue Mosque. Hotel is perfectly located in a narrow, quiet street just off the Hippodrome. Building was originally a guest house for Ibrahim Pasha's palace which is across the street and had been stylishly renovated. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and can provide good advice on local restaurants. The breakfasts are fabulous, a great selection of yoghurt, fruit and local breads and pastries. There is also a small rooftop terrace with views over the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and stylish hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: GS55
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, in a quiet side street but only yards from the Hippodrome and Blue Mosque. Comfortable sitting areas by an open fire to relax with a drink after a busy day's sightseeing (it was quite a cold day), and always a friendly and helpful person at the reception desk. We had a superior room which had a sofa and chair as well as large double bed and good en suite bathroom. The places we ate at from the hotel's list of recommended restaurants were all excellent, and they also tipped us off about a reliable and hassle-free carpet shop nearby. I would certainly stay here again if returning to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “atmosphere, location and personal service”
Reviews.Author: fodmen
Reviews.Content: Ibrahim Pasha has an excellent location in a very central but surprisingly quiet street and has a beautiful and relaxing atmosphere. The hotel is decorated in a creative way and with a lot of good taste. Each member of the staff was very friendly and motivated and we were happy to come back to the hotel all the time. Especially all the recommendations we received about the restaurants made a big contribution to our stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, relaxing hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ajane02
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights at the Ibrahim Pasha Hotel with 2 girlfriends. Our room overlooked the Blue Mosque (definitely check out the terrace for amazing views) and we all enjoyed the cozy feel and clean bathroom. The service was consistently friendly and attentive, breakfast was fabulous and kept us going all day. We also enjoyed coming back to the hotel's two fireplaces and curling up with books and tea after a long day of sightseeing. The hotel's wireless service was also easy and there's a laptop available for those who didn't bring their own computers. I would definitely recommend this to friends who want a reasonable price for quality, convenient location to most of the city's sights, and a relaxing and welcoming atmosphere. I hope I get to return!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character at good rates near where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: AlfaRomeaa
Reviews.Content: Lots of character, attention to detail, beautiful interior. Fire burning. Friendly reception desk. However, we got a better rate going through booking.com than we would have done going direct to the hotel. Good breakfast, proper orange juice (at an additional cost of TL5, but having had orange squash at another hotel we were happy to pay form the real thing), good coffee. The room was better than we had expected, with a little sitting room and television off the bedroom. Crisp, white, cotton sheets. The mosque is bang next door, so be prepared to be awoken at 6am. Good, clean shower. We were torn between this hotel and another one which had excellent reviews on Tripadvisor, but Ibrahim Pasha beats the other hands down overall for an extra Â£10 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- stay here if you can”
Reviews.Author: Visitor090
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, friendly staff, great location, and amazing breakfast, overall good value

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: grebe66
Reviews.Content: Our stay could not have been better. The atmosphere was warm and friendly, made even been warmer with the lovely wood fires and huge bookcases. The staff could not have been more helpful throughout our stay. Our room was beautifully decorated and furnished, though small it was adequate as there are comfortable sofas next to the fires on the ground floor. Our room was kept really clean and tidy throughout our stay. The buffet breakfasts are simple but offer all you could want, and again the staff very helpful. The location is superb, two minutes walk from the Blue Mosque (and only a few minutes from a Turkish Delight shop, which we only discovered on our last evening). The view from the Terrace of the Blue Mosque and out over the Bosphorus is stunning, particularly at dawn. The sound of the call to prayer echoes around the area (even at dawn), and reminds you where you are â€“ this is a living breathing city, not a museum piece.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly delightful”
Reviews.Author: homefromhomelover
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Rejected the first Deluxe room due to the problems other reviewers have mentioned with the shower which has caused some damp on one of the walls close to the bed. However, the second room we saw was lovely and spacious, modern but with lots of character, bed and linen were perfect and the shower was excellent. A nice view over the roof of the nearby museum and a glimpse of the Blue Mosque from the room and a stunning panorama from the pretty rooftop terrace (although I imagine it would be too hot there on a summer day as there is no shade). The breakfast was good and the free coffee and tea on demand throughout the day was a lovely touch. The lounge areas were lovely and cosy with a much-needed wood fire which scented the whole hotel beautifully. Location is quiet (apart from the calls to prayer from the Mosque which do wake you up at an unearthly hour but are very evocative) and very handy for main sights in Sultanahmet and the trams into other parts of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique”
Reviews.Author: bilgong2
Reviews.Content: Due to good reviews here and in travel books, we booked our honeymoon here after researching at least 10 other places. I highly recommend it here. The decor is tasteful and sophisticated, the whole place had a highly personal touch, not like styaing at the big chains. The guests staying here is also gave off a good vibe, sophisticated travelers-type. In our early 30s we were on the young side. The location is almost unbeatable, so close to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and the museum. Safe location. The rooftop view is unbeatable. You feel at ease here, they recognize your face when you enter. Airport transport service went fine and was reassuring. The driver didn't speak English so the entire ride was silent. FYI- if you stay at their standard room (139 Euros), it's very small, less than 200 sq feet. A queen/king bed barely fits in the room so I would not recommend for people who want space. It's the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed at, in among at least 75 hotels I've visited worldwide. But the fact that I would still recommend this hotel to friends says a lot about how good the ambience and the staff were there. Proximity to the Blue Mosque with 6 minarets blasting out morning prayer around 5am means that you will wake up in the morning due to the noise. Among their restaurant recommendations-Brikili (sp?), where you get a set menu with wine for 95 TL, was superb, so was Hamdi (kebab). Sofiyali was a let down and expensive compared to quality of food, plus most guests seemed to be tourists with their guidebooks. Breakfast might not suit everyone, especially people from the US. But Starbucks is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Delicious Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at the Ibrahim Pasha Hotel. The location is perfect: beside the museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts (former Ibrahim Pasha's Palace), half a block from the Hippodrome and the Blue Mosque entrance. It seem that it has been recently remodeled: everything seems to be very new. Our room was a small one, with an even smaller bathroom, but it did not bother us. Afterall, the view from hotel terrace is unforgetable... Staff was very nice and helped us suggesting good restaurants and making the needed reservations. Breakfast was very rich and we enjoyed complimentary tea anytime and fresh fruits in ours rooms a lot. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lizandjohnSydney
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed for 9 days at the Ibrahim Pasha and rate this hotel very highly. Fantastic location with sublime views of t he Blue Mosque from the terrace. Our deluxe room was very spacious with walk in wardrobe and plenty of storage. Staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. beautiful building and full of character. The breakfasts were delicious with plenty of choice. we would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again Liz and John Sydney Australia

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ptarmigan11
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location by the Blue Mosque, fantastic breakfast. Brilliant terrace with a bar. Small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul boutique hotel with bar terrace views”
Reviews.Author: TheTrainingScotsman
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel tucked just up the hill from the Blue Mosque. Staff are perfectly attentive and the quality breakfast is a bonus. You pay over the odds but get value for your euro with a roof-top bar that knocks the spots of most other hotel views in Istanbul and smart breakfast and lounging areas for planning whether to pace the sights or make the most of the comfortable hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC service, great location, fab breakfast, but there were some glitches”
Reviews.Author: Indig0Blue
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel very much and would go back in a heartbeat because the service simply could not be better, the kafalta (breakfast) was the best we had out of 5 hotels we stayed at in Turkey, and the location could not be beat. I've found I agree with the six or seven reviews I'd read here: that the rooftop terrace was magnificent, especially at dusk when you could watch the moon rise over the Blue Mosque, but that it's also true that it offers no shade and so would be too hot to spend much time on it in the middle of the day. You can walk to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi, and of course the Blue Mosque; the kapilicarsa (covered market) is a short tram ride away. The breakfast was really superb; most places offer tomatoes, olives, feta, bread, jam, and coffee or tea and fruit; this was the only place we visited that also offered delicious Turkish borek (a savory pastry not unlike the Greek spanikopita), home-made by one of the workers wives! Oh, it was fabulous. I'm still dreaming of those borek! The very best thing was the service. The management and the workers all bent over backwards to help us, and we sincerely appreciate them for that. Very professional, very nice. They proactively provide maps, advice for getting around, warned us about taxi drivers who might take the long way to to hotel and called taxis for us from the hotel to help ensure that it didn't happen (and indeed, when we hailed a cab from our destination to the hotel it was a lot more). In the interest of giving a complete and fair review to other travellers, however, I do have to admit that certain things did come up during our stay that might upset the average traveller. The wireless connection did not work from our room the entire time of our stay. It did work in the lounge area, however, where there is also a computer available for guest use. The hotel management did have calls out to their service provider and were trying to work on this, which we appreciated. It didn't affect us because I wasn't planning to be on the computer, but under different circumstances, the lack of service (when we had counted on it) would have been disastrous. We stayed in two rooms, one at the beginning of a multi-city trip and one at the end. It is true that the "standard" room at the beginning of the trip is a little small as others have said. However, we found it so well designed (i.e. with built-in luggage racks that slide out like drawers) and so pretty that we didn't mind the small size. The only real problem is that the bathroom did have a tile over the drain, as described in another trip advisor review. It is also true that there was some visible mildew in the shower tile. The biggest problem was with the second room, which was amazingly beautiful but somewhat disfunctional. The blinds fell down twice--and we were very gentle with them. It's true that the private terrace did not look out onto anything but another building, but we didn't mind--it was just nice to have a little outdoor area to go. The real problem was again the bathroom: any time you took a shower, which was in a tub, the bathroom would flood with water. Specifically what would happen is that there is a ledge between the tub and a window, that looks out onto the room (you can close the blinds for privacy, but it actually is a very cool effect for couples) There is no drain on that ledge, so the water hits the ledge and has nowhere to go, and so it ends up on the floor and floods. When I say "flood" I mean: four huge beach-sized towels can't mop it up. There is a slight decline in the flooring so that the water eventually ends up near the toilet, which does have a drain in the floor.
